examples: The Canadian team handed the game to them on a silver plate.
The girl held her father's hand tightly.
She handed me a clean plate for dessert.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The prisoner held his head in his hands.
words.defineEn: the part of our body that is at the end of our arm and we use to grab, move, or feel things
words.defineVi: phần cơ thể nằm ở cuối cánh tay và chúng ta dùng để nắm lấy, di chuyển hoặc cảm nhận đồ vật

examples: So it's the thumbs up for Brighton's latest nightclub.
He was very much under the thumb of his father.
In Japan a European stands out like a sore thumb.
I'm all thumbs when it comes to making bows.
They hope the audience will give a thumbs up to the TV series.
words.defineEn: the thick finger that has a different position than the other four
words.defineVi: ngón dày có vị trí khác với bốn ngón còn lại

examples: Point your index finger in the direction of a.
Put our index finger in the direction of L1.
My index finger going in the direction of L1.
Your index finger will go in the direction of a.
So I put my index finger in the direction of L2.
words.defineEn: the finger that is next to the thumb; the second digit of the human hand
words.defineVi: ngón tay bên cạnh ngón tay cái; chữ số thứ hai của bàn tay con người

examples: The next finger is the middle finger.
Middle finger is the second term of the cross product.
Move the middle finger twice.
Your middle finger goes in the direction of b.
So that's my middle finger.
words.defineEn: the longest finger of the hand; the third digit of the human hand
words.defineVi: ngón dài nhất của bàn tay; chữ số thứ ba của bàn tay con người

examples: The next finger is the ring finger.
And then the fourth finger, your ring finger would be enormous.
My ring finger can't really move like that.
For example, an extended ring finger is a meaningful handshape in Taiwainese Sign Language but not in BSL or ASL.
But you lost me with the ring finger.
words.defineEn: the finger next to the little finger, especially on the left hand; the fourth digit of the human hand
words.defineVi: ngón cạnh ngón út, nhất là bàn tay trái; chữ số thứ tư của bàn tay con người

examples: Yeah, I can do it with pinkie.
Your teeth do normally what pinkies would do?
words.defineEn: our smallest finger that is also the furthest away from our thumb
words.defineVi: ngón tay nhỏ nhất của chúng tôi cũng là ngón tay cái xa nhất của chúng tôi

examples: Drug barons were greasing the palm of the chief of police.
I'll have him in the palm of my hand in no time.
If you want to get something done around here, you have to grease someone's palm.
He likes to cook his french fries in palm oil for a crispy texture.
There's a second way through this situation but it involves greasing your boss's palms.
words.defineEn: the inner surface of the hand between the wrist and fingers
words.defineVi: bề mặt bên trong của bàn tay giữa cổ tay và ngón tay

examples: He put his fist through a glass door.
The patriarch has always been an iron fist in a velvet glove.
a king who ruled his country with an iron fist.
They promised that the army would strike with an iron fist at any resistance.
Other people knock fists.
words.defineEn: the hand with the fingers tightly bent toward the palm
words.defineVi: bàn tay với các ngón tay uốn cong về phía lòng bàn tay
